hourly.summary: Arsenal fans are riding high with positive vibes after their women's team clinched the FIFA Women's Champions Cup and the men's title charge got a boost from Spurs doing them a favor. There's euphoric chatter about writing 'Arsenal history,' loan moves, and title race momentum, though injury news (Merino) adds a slight note of concern. 'Fucking awesome' camaraderie among Gooners sums up the mood.

daily.summary: Arsenal fan sentiment fluctuated throughout the day, starting with cautious optimism after a win over Leeds, peaking with title buzz post-Man City/Spurs draw, but tempered by midday frustrations around player form and tactical debates. The period closed on a strong hopeful note (9/10) as rival results revitalized title hopes, though undercut by classic Arsenal superstition and injury concerns.

weekly.summary: The overall vibe trend for Arsenal fans over this weekly period started with cautious optimism and shifted to euphoria mid-week, driven by strong performances and transfer rumors. However, sentiment declined sharply after a disappointing loss to Manchester United, ending the period on a volatile note.
